channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Dem strategists say Harris needs to ensure she's 'striking the right balance' at DNC, seize on 'momentum'
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris needs to ensure she is “striking the right balance" at the Democratic National Convention, according to Democratic strategists, as the race formally enters the general election.

item.title: Trump calls Harris economic proposals 'communist,' vows to put sweeping tariffs on imported goods
item.description: Former President Donald Trump on Saturday teed off on Vice President Kamala Harris' newly unveiled economic proposals, arguing they were "communist" while vowing to implement sweeping tariffs at a campaign rally in Wilkes-Barre, Pennsylvania.

item.title: The Evangelical Political Conundrum Is Not New
item.description: American politics forces Evangelicals to grapple with the tension between political expediency and the integrity of their faith.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Feds Are Helping Register Alabama Prisoners To Vote
item.description: Feds 'deployed' a 'liberal' org to help register Alabaman federal prisoners to vote, according to a statement from the secretary of state.

item.title: Strategists pin GOP Senate hopes on Trump base coming 'home' ahead of election
item.description: Strategists feel confident that GOP voters will ultimately fall in line behind Republican Senate candidates as the 2024 election approaches.

item.title: Harris campaign to launch $370 million battleground state ad blitz after Labor Day
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris' campaign on Saturday announced it will bombard swing states with $370 million in ads from the day after Labor Day to Election Day.

item.title: The Voter-Registration Guide Will See You Now
item.description: A worrisome new consensus in the medical community holds that doctors should be as concerned with politics as they are with medicine.

item.title: Can Georgia’s Elections Board Require Paper Ballots?
item.description: The fate of the country could potentially hinge on the outcome in Georgia -- it's only fair that the outcome is determined by legitimate votes.

item.title: New NYC Council bill would limit pepper spray use in jails except in emergency situations
item.description: A new bill introduced in the New York City Council would limit correction officers' use of pepper spray on out of control inmates in the city's jails, except in emergency situations.

item.title: Tim Walz returns to his home state where there's a battle over a key Nebraska electoral vote
item.description: Thousands of Nebraskans are expected to turn out on Saturday for native son Tim Walz on his first trip back to his home state since becoming the Democratic vice presidential nominee.

item.title: James L. Buckley, One Year Later
item.description: On the anniversary of his death last August, a few who knew ‘the sainted junior senator from New York’ remember his legacy.

item.title: ESPN Axes Host Days After She Voiced Opposition To Men Competing In Women’s Sports
item.description: ESPN has fired a host who recently voiced opposition to female-identifying men competing in women’s sports. On Thursday, The Athletic reported that ESPN has terminated the contract of “Sunday NFL Countdown” host Samantha Ponder, a longtime reporter for the network who previously covered college football. Former NFL quarterback Robert Griffin III was also fired by […]

item.title: Trump says Harris has gone 'full communist' after unveiling handout-filled economic policy: 'Never worked'
item.description: Former President Trump slammed Vice President Kamala Harris during a Pennsylvania campaign rally Saturday for her "socialist price controls."

item.title: Ex-Rep. Santos expected to plead guilty, avoid prison
item.description: Former Congressman George Santos could plead guilty next week to numerous federal charges related to campaign finance fraud.

item.title: The Failure of Fact-Checking in an Election Year Is Especially Painful
item.description: The rubric is ‘Heads Democrats win, tails Republicans lose,’ and we see it over and over.

item.title: 13th Oregon County To Support Ditching Blue State For Idaho Urges ‘Legislative Action’ On Redrawing Border
item.description: 'Citizens encourage continued discussions with our Idahoan neighbors regarding the possibility of a westward relocation of the Oregon-Idaho border...'

item.title: Michael Moore's stark warning to Democrats on election momentum: 'It’s ours to blow'
item.description: Documentary filmmaker Michael Moore says Vice President Kamala Harris should continue doing "weird and cringe" until the debate and then beat former President Trump on the debate stage.

item.title: Harris will meet with Teamsters, but union president isn't invited to speak at Democratic convention
item.description: Members of the Teamsters will host Vice President Kamala Harris for a roundtable discussion in the near future, but union President Sean O'Brien has yet to get an invitation to speak at next week's Democratic National Convention.

item.title: How Former Teacher and Coach Tim Walz Betrayed Minnesota Students
item.description: As governor during the Covid pandemic, Walz kept schools closed and hamstrung youth sports.

item.title: J6 ‘Praying Grandma’ Slammed With Six-Figure Fine And Probation For Walking Around Capitol
item.description: A Colorado grandmother was sentenced to a six-figure fine plus a year of probation for praying at the Capitol grounds on Jan. 6, 2021.
